page.title: 05Farming in the Area
page.content: The farms in this area vary in size between about 40 acres to about 800 acres. Temple House Farm is next to our school. The farmer grows grass for his dairy cows. They graze in the grass in summer and other fields are mown by a machine and harvested to be made into silage to feed his 200 cows in the winter. Other farms in the area keep flocks of sheep.They produce fat lambs and wool which is sent to the wool marketing board who grade it and then it is made into clothes. Another farm in the area only grows potatoes,wheat,barley and oats. My farm,Temple Farm,buys calves and store cattle.We grow barley,wheat,oats and sweetcorn maize to feed cattle. We have a man who comes and grinds up all of the corn ready for cattle to eat.
